bio.p: Brandon Brown is an associate professor in the Department of Social Medicine, Population and Public Health at the University of California, Riverside School of Medicine where he is a member of the institutional review board, teaches public health and medical ethics, and conducts community based participatory research. Brandon recently helped to update the HIV Prevention Trials Networks research ethics guidelines and has published on the experience of people aging with HIV who are further isolated by the COVID‚Äê19 pandemic. With over 130 publications, Brandon has received funding from several federal and private organizations, working closely with community partners in all research.
